physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr P has been diagnosed with mild cognitive impairment due to brain vascular disease. He exhibits memory impairment, lacks insight into his condition, experiences excessive daytime napping, nighttime restlessness, and feelings of insecurity and loneliness.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By 2010, Mr P's MMSE score declined from 29 to 21, indicating worsening cognitive function consistent with mild progressive dementia.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr P was taken to the emergency department after becoming lost and falling at home. He demonstrated anxiety and auditory hallucinations, particularly at night.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: His caregiver reported an increase in confusion and repetitive questioning, alongside worsening of nighttime restlessness and episodes of hearing voices.
